item.title: The Scent of Green Papaya
item.description:
Tran Anh Hung’s slice of life shows the world through the eyes of a Vietnamese peasant-girl, Mui, growing up in Saigon in 1951. It won the Cam√©ra d’Or (best film by new director) at Cannes in 1993 and is the first of five collaborations between him and his wife, Tran Nu Yen Khe.

This movie is hidden gem. A slow-burn with exceptional camera-work, its full of contradictions: minimal movements and stillness in the shots highlight the constant motion of everyday life. A story filled with emotionally charged themes like abject poverty, familial abandonment, and unrequited love amongst other things somehow ends up being a relaxing and poignant tale.

item.title: Hello! I'm Ali.
item.description:
I’m interested in:

  • Computer Science / Software Engineering
  • Films and Shows

item.title: recommended
item.description:
• Teach Yourself CS: Especially the computer architecture course based on Computer Systems: A Programmer’s Perspective - learn how software & hardware interact during a program’s execution.
  • A Relational Model of Data for Large Shared Data Banks: Edgar F. Codd creates the relational model for data storage, using mathematical logic and set theory to ensure data integrity. Led to SQL and essentially all modern RDBMSs.
  • Fast Algorithms for Mining Association Rules: Seminal research on how to discover associations between transactions in massive datasets.
  • The Hadoop Distributed File System: Storing massive datasets on distributed clusters.
  • Resilient Distributed Datasets: The core distributed computing abstraction used in Apache Spark.
